what: Plot a sample sounding for Shearwater, Nova Scotia, Canada.
title: Introduction to the atmospheric Package
text: example uses sample data file provided package, otherwise building vignette can yield error, server (Reference 1) unreachable busy return files. several errors deficiencies graph, including following. lines sloping left (curved) dry adiabats, erroneously straight reflect just near-surface lapse rate wet adiabats added water fraction added wind barbs added text summaries added Skew-T log-P sounding profile Shearwater, Nova Scotia, Canada, July 11, 2024. wider line represents temperature thinner line represents dew point. curves skewed right; read values, trace 45 degree lines horizontal axis.

title: Authors and Citation
text: Kelley D (2024). atmosphere: Analysis Atmospheric Data. R package version 0.0.1, https://dankelley.github.io/atmosphere/, https://github.com/dankelley/atmosphere/.
code: @Manual{,   title = {atmosphere: Analysis of Atmospheric Data},   author = {Dan Kelley},   year = {2024},   note = {R package version 0.0.1, https://dankelley.github.io/atmosphere/},   url = {https://github.com/dankelley/atmosphere/}, }

title: Analysis of Atmospheric Data
text: atmosphere package provides R functions dealing atmospheric properties. preliminary, function names actions may change lot moment.

title: Download atmospheric sounding data — downloadAtmosphericSounding
text: date string date, yyyy-mm-dd format, form .POSIXlt() can convert date datetime. provided, previous day used (early-morning call function might yield failed download). region character value indicating region. defaults "naconf. stationName character value indicating station name, present function converts station number stationNumber().

what: Dry lapse rate in degC / m — dryLapseRate
title: Dry lapse rate in degC / m — dryLapseRate
Dry lapse rate in degC / m — dryLapseRate
Dry lapse rate in degC / m — dryLapseRate
text: g numeric value acceleration due gravity sea level, default listed Reference 1, converted m/s^2. C_P numeric value specific heat air sea level, default listed Reference 1, converted J/(kg*K).

title: Dry lapse rate in degC / m — dryLapseRate
text: dryLapseRate returns lapse rate, degrees C (Kelvin) per metre.

title: Dry lapse rate in degC / m — dryLapseRate
Dry lapse rate in degC / m — dryLapseRate
Plot atmospheric sounding data — plot
text: preliminary version.  time, might evolved plot something nearer shown Reference 1.

title: Plot atmospheric sounding data — plot
text: sounding result call readAtmosphericSounding(). item character value indicating plot. moment, choices default, "DWPT+TEMP". legend logical value indicating whether show legend top- left corner.  FALSE default. mar 4-element numeric vector specifying margins, standard way (.e. handed par() function). default set give space height indications right margin. mgp 3-element numeric vector specifying axis spacing, usual way (.e. handed par() function). default removes whitespace margins. debug integer specifying whether information printed processing. default, 0, means avoid printing. positive value means print information.  (information vary course evolution code, rely particular behaviour.)

title: Plot atmospheric sounding data — plot
text: https://www.noaa.gov/jetstream/upperair/skew-t-log-p-diagrams Visual Explanation Meteorological Skew T Log P Sounding Diagrams, 2019. https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=7p7c85hhgOo.

title: Read atmospheric sounding data — readAtmosphericSounding
text: Read HTML file downloaded downloadAtmosphericSounding().  code works recognizing portions file preformatted blocks, brittle method fail HTML format used server website changes.  Obviously, better work csv json files, way know download files, since server provides documentation.

title: Read atmospheric sounding data — readAtmosphericSounding
text: file character value indicating name sounding file. file must downloaded downloadAtmosphericSounding().

title: Read atmospheric sounding data — readAtmosphericSounding
code: library(atmosphere) file <- system.file("extdata", "Shearwater_2024-07-11.txt.gz", package = "atmosphere") sounding <- readAtmosphericSounding(file)

title: Determine skew skew-T diagrams — skew
text: Based plotted data range figure geometry, determines temperature skew equivalent 45 degree rotation isotherms.  warning issued graph far square axes cover unexpected ranges.

title: Determine skew skew-T diagrams — skew
text: pressure numeric vector holding pressures sounding dataset.

title: Determine skew skew-T diagrams — skew
text: skew returns value added temperature, function supplied pressure.

what: Find station number from name — stationNumber
title: Find station number from name — stationNumber
Find station number from name — stationNumber
Find station number from name — stationNumber
text: name character value indicating name station. far, two choices: "Shearwater"`` "Nashville"`.

title: Find station number from name — stationNumber
Summarize a sounding — summary
code: library(atmosphere) file <- system.file("extdata", "Shearwater_2024-07-11.txt.gz", package = "atmosphere") sounding <- readAtmosphericSounding(file) summary(sounding) #> Station AWE (#73110 at -63.50E, 44.63N) on 2024-07-11: 11 data and 27 metadata

what: Compute air in-situ temperature from potential temperature — temperatureFromTheta
title: Compute air in-situ temperature from potential temperature — temperatureFromTheta
text: -situ temperature computed Reference 1, multiplying potential temperature ratio actual reference pressure, raised power R/Cp.  Although R Cp can specified function, default values recommended consistency.

title: Compute air in-situ temperature from potential temperature — temperatureFromTheta
Compute air in-situ temperature from potential temperature — temperatureFromTheta
text: theta numeric value indicating potential temperature Kelvin. pressure numeric value indicating pressure Pa. R dry-air gas constant, default value 287.052874 Reference 2. Cp dry-air mass-specific heat, default value 1003.5 J/kg/K Reference 3.  (Note 1005 given websites.)
